title: EU salvage mission successful after securing burning Houthi-hit oil tanker
content: The Greek-owned MV Sounion oil tanker, damaged by Yemen's Houthi fighters, has been safely relocated in the Red Sea with no reported oil spillage. Abandoned after a missile attack on August 21, the tanker carried nearly one million barrels of crude oil. An EU-coordinated salvage operation involving three vessels and a warship prevented an environmental disaster.
summary: The Greek-owned MV Sounion oil tanker, damaged by Yemen's Houthi fighters, has been safely relocated in the Red Sea with no reported oil spillage. Abandoned after a missile attack on August 21, the tanker carried nearly one million barrels of crude oil. An EU-coordinated salvage operation involving three vessels and a warship prevented an environmental disaster.

title: When Melania, Jill, Michelle, Hillary met last year: 'First Ladies are not mean girls'
content: ​Melania was very smiley but uncertain and was expecting people to be nice to her. "We were. We all went up to her...Jill air-kissed her cheek, and Michelle Obama gave one her of her signature big hugs," Hillary wrote. "Bill tried to make conversation, asking her how she was, but he was met with a smile and few words. I reached out, shook her hand, ” Hillary wrote.
summary: ​Melania was very smiley but uncertain and was expecting people to be nice to her. "We were. We all went up to her...Jill air-kissed her cheek, and Michelle Obama gave one her of her signature big hugs," Hillary wrote. "Bill tried to make conversation, asking her how she was, but he was met with a smile and few words. I reached out, shook her hand, ” Hillary wrote.

title: Is Sri Lanka next? How presidential polls could impact Delhi-Colombo ties
content: Sri Lanka's presidential election on September 21 holds significant implications for its foreign relations with India. Key candidates who'll be fighting the upcoming elections include Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sajith Premadasa, and Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Amid a severe economic crisis, the election's outcome is crucial for regional stability and India's strategic interests in South Asia.
summary: Sri Lanka's presidential election on September 21 holds significant implications for its foreign relations with India. Key candidates who'll be fighting the upcoming elections include Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sajith Premadasa, and Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Amid a severe economic crisis, the election's outcome is crucial for regional stability and India's strategic interests in South Asia.

title: Chinese warplanes tail US military aircraft in Taiwan strait
content: Chinese warplanes tailed a US P-8A Poseidon aircraft through the Taiwan Strait, according to the PLA's Eastern Theater Command. This incident comes amid heightened regional tensions and follows Germany's recent naval transit through the strait. The US Navy has not yet commented on this event.
summary: Chinese warplanes tailed a US P-8A Poseidon aircraft through the Taiwan Strait, according to the PLA's Eastern Theater Command. This incident comes amid heightened regional tensions and follows Germany's recent naval transit through the strait. The US Navy has not yet commented on this event.

title: Japan suspends trial removal of Fukushima nuclear debris
content: TEPCO has suspended efforts to extract highly radioactive material from Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant due to a technical problem with remote cameras. This extraction is essential for decommissioning the facility, which was severely damaged by a tsunami in 2011. Engineers must resolve this issue before continuing the operation.
summary: TEPCO has suspended efforts to extract highly radioactive material from Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant due to a technical problem with remote cameras. This extraction is essential for decommissioning the facility, which was severely damaged by a tsunami in 2011. Engineers must resolve this issue before continuing the operation.

title: Terrorists target military school in Mali capital: Army
content: Mali's army stated that Bamako is under control after an early morning terrorist attack on a gendarmerie training school. Gunfire was reported across the city, prompting residents to stay indoors. This incident highlights the persistent security issues in Mali, which has been fighting an Islamist insurgency since 2012.
summary: Mali's army stated that Bamako is under control after an early morning terrorist attack on a gendarmerie training school. Gunfire was reported across the city, prompting residents to stay indoors. This incident highlights the persistent security issues in Mali, which has been fighting an Islamist insurgency since 2012.

title: Georgia woman dies after abortion ban causes delay in medical care
content: Amber Nicole Thurman, a 28-year-old single mother from Georgia, died after complications arose during an abortion procedure delayed by Georgia’s six-week abortion ban. This incident is the first verified death linked to such bans post-Roe v Wade. A state committee deemed her death preventable if timely medical intervention had been provided.
summary: Amber Nicole Thurman, a 28-year-old single mother from Georgia, died after complications arose during an abortion procedure delayed by Georgia’s six-week abortion ban. This incident is the first verified death linked to such bans post-Roe v Wade. A state committee deemed her death preventable if timely medical intervention had been provided.

title: Hoiho wins New Zealand's Bird of the Year award
content: The yellow-eyed penguin, known as hoiho, secured New Zealand’s Bird of the Year award, drawing attention to its endangered status. With a population drop of 78% in 15 years, this recognition is timely. Endorsements from notable figures and various groups contributed to the successful campaign aimed at boosting conservation efforts.
summary: The yellow-eyed penguin, known as hoiho, secured New Zealand’s Bird of the Year award, drawing attention to its endangered status. With a population drop of 78% in 15 years, this recognition is timely. Endorsements from notable figures and various groups contributed to the successful campaign aimed at boosting conservation efforts.

title: 'Whether we like it or not ... ': Donald Trump introduces World Liberty Financial, his new cryptocurrency venture
content: After an assassination attempt, Donald Trump introduced his new cryptocurrency venture, World Liberty Financial, with his sons and two crypto entrepreneurs. The initiative has raised concerns about conflicts of interest if Trump wins the election. The project's specifics are unclear but involve a new cryptocurrency called $WLFI.
summary: After an assassination attempt, Donald Trump introduced his new cryptocurrency venture, World Liberty Financial, with his sons and two crypto entrepreneurs. The initiative has raised concerns about conflicts of interest if Trump wins the election. The project's specifics are unclear but involve a new cryptocurrency called $WLFI.

title: Birthday wishes or just formality? The truth behind William's message to Harry
content: Prince William shows no interest in reconciling with Prince Harry despite wishing him a happy 40th birthday. The gesture was mainly to align with King Charles, who publicly expressed his love for Harry. Both brothers attended their uncle's funeral but did not interact.
summary: Prince William shows no interest in reconciling with Prince Harry despite wishing him a happy 40th birthday. The gesture was mainly to align with King Charles, who publicly expressed his love for Harry. Both brothers attended their uncle's funeral but did not interact.

title: Chinese woman goes into coma after assault by husband, wakes up to permanent blindness
content: Lao Chunxue from Inner Mongolia was violently attacked by her husband Xie over money to support his gaming addiction. The assault left her blind and severely injured. Xie was sentenced to 11 years in prison, but Lao's family is appealing for a life sentence. The incident has sparked widespread outrage online.
summary: Lao Chunxue from Inner Mongolia was violently attacked by her husband Xie over money to support his gaming addiction. The assault left her blind and severely injured. Xie was sentenced to 11 years in prison, but Lao's family is appealing for a life sentence. The incident has sparked widespread outrage online.

title: Meet Jonathan, world's oldest living land animal, who is 191 years old
content: Jonathan the Tortoise, born in 1832, is recognized as the oldest known living land animal. Currently residing on Saint Helena, his life exemplifies longevity and resilience. Jonathan's story emphasizes the importance of wildlife conservation and biodiversity preservation, serving as an inspiration for global efforts to protect tortoises and other endangered species.
summary: Jonathan the Tortoise, born in 1832, is recognized as the oldest known living land animal. Currently residing on Saint Helena, his life exemplifies longevity and resilience. Jonathan's story emphasizes the importance of wildlife conservation and biodiversity preservation, serving as an inspiration for global efforts to protect tortoises and other endangered species.

title: Women seen without hijabs on Mahsa Amini's death anniversary in Iran
content: Women in Iran were observed without hijabs, and prisoners began a hunger strike to commemorate the second anniversary of Mahsa Amini's death. Amini died in custody for allegedly violating dress codes, leading to widespread protests against Iran’s government and its strict hijab laws.
summary: Women in Iran were observed without hijabs, and prisoners began a hunger strike to commemorate the second anniversary of Mahsa Amini's death. Amini died in custody for allegedly violating dress codes, leading to widespread protests against Iran’s government and its strict hijab laws.

title: Japan’s elderly population hits record high
content: Japan's elderly population has surged to a record high of 36.25 million, representing 29.3 percent of the total populace. This demographic trend is escalating medical and welfare expenses amid a declining labour force. In response, a record number of elderly individuals—9.14 million—were employed in 2023, constituting 13.5 per cent of the workforce.
summary: Japan's elderly population has surged to a record high of 36.25 million, representing 29.3 percent of the total populace. This demographic trend is escalating medical and welfare expenses amid a declining labour force. In response, a record number of elderly individuals—9.14 million—were employed in 2023, constituting 13.5 per cent of the workforce.

title: Trump assassination bid: Secret Service defends 'textbook' response
content: The Secret Service successfully prevented an assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, with an agent quickly responding to a suspect brandishing a weapon near Mar-a-Lago. Acting Director Ronald Rowe Jr praised the agency’s protective measures but acknowledged the strain on agents after an earlier attempt on Trump in July, which led to public criticism and the resignation of former Director Kimberly Cheatle.
summary: The Secret Service successfully prevented an assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, with an agent quickly responding to a suspect brandishing a weapon near Mar-a-Lago. Acting Director Ronald Rowe Jr praised the agency’s protective measures but acknowledged the strain on agents after an earlier attempt on Trump in July, which led to public criticism and the resignation of former Director Kimberly Cheatle.

title: Meta bans Russian news agencies over 'foreign interference activity'
content: Meta has banned Russian news agency RT, Rossiya Segodnya, and other state-controlled media networks for allegedly engaging in deceptive tactics to avoid detection. The ban will be enforced globally across Meta's platforms like Facebook and Instagram. This action follows US charges against RT employees accused of influencing the 2024 election through online content.
summary: Meta has banned Russian news agency RT, Rossiya Segodnya, and other state-controlled media networks for allegedly engaging in deceptive tactics to avoid detection. The ban will be enforced globally across Meta's platforms like Facebook and Instagram. This action follows US charges against RT employees accused of influencing the 2024 election through online content.

title: 'Our business is in a difficult period': Boeing considers layoffs amid workers' strike
content: In response to an ongoing factory workers' strike, Boeing has introduced several cost-saving measures. These include a hiring freeze, pausing pay increases for managers and executives, and halting non-essential travel. Temporary layoffs are also being considered as the strike poses significant risks to Boeing's financial recovery and plane delivery schedules.
summary: In response to an ongoing factory workers' strike, Boeing has introduced several cost-saving measures. These include a hiring freeze, pausing pay increases for managers and executives, and halting non-essential travel. Temporary layoffs are also being considered as the strike poses significant risks to Boeing's financial recovery and plane delivery schedules.

title: Historic rainfall triggers severe flooding in North Carolina
content: A powerful storm system brought historic rainfall to coastal North Carolina, causing severe flooding and significant disruptions. Carolina Beach declared a state of emergency after receiving 18 inches of rain in 12 hours. Emergency services conducted numerous rescues as homes and vehicles were submerged. The region remains under flood watch until Tuesday despite the storm weakening.
summary: A powerful storm system brought historic rainfall to coastal North Carolina, causing severe flooding and significant disruptions. Carolina Beach declared a state of emergency after receiving 18 inches of rain in 12 hours. Emergency services conducted numerous rescues as homes and vehicles were submerged. The region remains under flood watch until Tuesday despite the storm weakening.

title: Russians urged to have sex during work breaks to boost birth rate: Report
content: President Vladimir Putin has introduced a policy urging Russians to have sex during work breaks to combat the nation's declining birth rate. The initiative includes free fertility checks and financial incentives for new mothers. Stricter abortion access and increased divorce fees are also part of the strategy, aiming to reverse the projected population decline by 2050.
summary: President Vladimir Putin has introduced a policy urging Russians to have sex during work breaks to combat the nation's declining birth rate. The initiative includes free fertility checks and financial incentives for new mothers. Stricter abortion access and increased divorce fees are also part of the strategy, aiming to reverse the projected population decline by 2050.

title: Texas declares Venezuela-based gang a 'terrorist' group
content: Officials in Texas on Monday designated a Venezuelan gang called the Tren de Aragua as a "foreign terrorist group" and endorsed Donald Trump's claim that many migrants crossing into the United States were released from prisons in Latin America. Appearing at the same press conference as Banks, Governor Greg Abbott formally declared Tren de Aragua a "foreign terrorist organization."
summary: Officials in Texas on Monday designated a Venezuelan gang called the Tren de Aragua as a "foreign terrorist group" and endorsed Donald Trump's claim that many migrants crossing into the United States were released from prisons in Latin America. Appearing at the same press conference as Banks, Governor Greg Abbott formally declared Tren de Aragua a "foreign terrorist organization."
